meanings.sent1: The overpumped balloon burst with a loud pop.
meanings.sent2: The overpumped tire quickly deflated after hitting a sharp rock.
meanings.sent3: The overpumped ego of the actor led to many people avoiding him.
meanings.sent4: Her overpumped enthusiasm for the project was contagious to everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The overpumped balloon animal twisted into strange shapes at the party.

meanings.sent1: He overpumped the bike tire until it exploded.
meanings.sent2: She realized she had overpumped the air mattress when it became too firm to sleep on.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally overpumped the cream into the dessert, creating a messy situation.
meanings.sent4: The gardener overpumped the water into the flower bed, causing the plants to wilt.
meanings.sent5: The athlete overpumped his muscles, leading to soreness the next day.

meanings.definition: To be overly excited or enthusiastic.
meanings.sent1: The fans were overpumped to meet their favorite singer backstage.
meanings.sent2: She overpumped her speech with so much energy that the audience couldn't help but be engaged.
meanings.sent3: The children were overpumped about the upcoming field trip to the zoo.
meanings.sent4: His overpumped reaction to winning the game was captured on camera for all to see.
meanings.sent5: The students were overpumped for the surprise pizza party in the classroom.
